alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 10 at 4:35PM AKST until December 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. North winds gusting as high as 30 mph for north and west Anchorage. Easterly winds gusting as high as 65 mph across the upper Anchorage Hillside tonight. Visibility reduced to as low as one half mile. Overnight snow accumulation of 1-3 inches possible over higher elevations and near Turnagain Arm. * WHERE...Anchorage. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. Strong winds could cause significant drifting of snow on area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty north winds will strengthen across north and west Anchorage this evening into the overnight hours before diminishing early Monday morning. The strong winds will lift easily transportable snow already on the ground leading to significant drifting and blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
